meta.title: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

div.div: GEICO CAVEMAN SITCOM SHOULD STAY DEAD

div.a: Can Neanderthals Be Brought Back From The Dead?

div.div: Synthetic biology expert George Church of Harvard University explains how DNA will become the building material of the future -- one that can help create virus-resistant human beings and possibly bring back lost species like the Neanderthal.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/10FdN28&via=Digg&text=Can Neanderthals Be Brought Back From The Dead?

div.a: This Is What The Urban Dictionary Looks Like On Google Images

div.div: Motherboard thought it might be fun to select the first Google Images result for one Urban Dictionary term per letter of the alphabet. Along with that image, we’ve included Urban Dictionary’s top definition—a.k.a., the one that got the most votes.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/V4K8Jt&via=Digg&text=This Is What The Urban Dictionary Looks Like On Google Images

div.div: DO WE NEED ROADS WHERE THESE CARS ARE GOING?

div.a: 7 Imaginative Attempts To Improve The DeLorean

div.div: Since 1985, the DeLorean has had a cult following, with many fans daydreaming about some awfully impressive ways to improve the sports car. From hovercrafts to monster-trucks, take a look at some of the most out-there ideas.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/106WukG&via=Digg&text=7 Imaginative Attempts To Improve The DeLorean

div.a: Can Ubiquitous Surveillance Ever Be Ethical?

div.div: If ubiquitous surveillance and lack of privacy are the trends of the future, we shouldn’t just begrudgingly accept them, but demand that society gets the most possible out of them.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/10m29Ie&via=Digg&text=Can Ubiquitous Surveillance Ever Be Ethical?

div.a: Would-Be Assassin Pulls Gun On Political Leader On Live TV

div.div: What looks to be an assassination attempt is barely avoided, while the TV cameras roll.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YfcuoW&via=Digg&text=Would-Be Assassin Pulls Gun On Political Leader On Live TV

div.a: How To Ditch Your Cable Internet Provider Forever

div.div: Here are four broadband alternatives that don't require a visit from the cable guy.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VBzmeV&via=Digg&text=How To Ditch Your Cable Internet Provider Forever

div.a: The 20 Most Influential Beers Of All Time

div.div: As the beer market matures, it's important to have a sense of context—to understand how we got here, and appreciate the trailblazers that took brewing to new heights (or dragged it so low that others were inspired to fight back). These are the OGs of craft beer.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/13lzlhQ&via=Digg&text=The 20 Most Influential Beers Of All Time

div.a: NASA Is Using A Laser To Send Mona Lisa To The Moon

div.div: NASA has turned the Mona Lisa into the first digital image to be transmitted via laser beam from Earth to a spacecraft in lunar orbit, nearly 240,000 miles away, thanks to a technology that may soon become routine.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XimYxX&via=Digg&text=NASA Is Using A Laser To Send Mona Lisa To The Moon

div.a: 11 Famous Business Cards That Became Legendary

div.div: There are plenty more famous business cards that you just have to see to believe.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XkdWQh&via=Digg&text=11 Famous Business Cards That Became Legendary

div.a: Horse Meat Found In Some Burgers; Supermarket Chain Sends This Unfortunate Tweet

div.div: Tesco is one of the big UK supermarket chains, a pioneer of the pile it high and sell it cheap method of retailing. It’s also embroiled in a small scandal at present: the presence of horsemeat in some of its burger products. That's what makes this tweet so outrageous.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/11GZrxs&via=Digg&text=Horse Meat Found In Some Burgers; Supermarket Chain Sends This Unfortunate Tweet

div.a: Mega Launches As 'The Privacy Company' Amid A Huge Surge Of Interest

div.div: The site opened up for early access yesterday, but now everyone can go to Mega to sign up and use the service, with offers 50GB of free access, plus three pricing tiers with additional storage and bandwidth capacity.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WdYkhS&via=Digg&text=Mega Launches As 'The Privacy Company' Amid A Huge Surge Of Interest

div.a: The Latest, Deadliest Gun Innovations, Brought To You By A Newtown Company

div.div: Since the Sandy Hook massacre, there have been 1,013 deaths from gun violence in the United States. Meanwhile, one of the country's biggest gun shows--sponsored by a Newtown-based group--is currently underway in Las Vegas.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VbWXph&via=Digg&text=The Latest, Deadliest Gun Innovations, Brought To You By A Newtown Company

div.a: This Calculator Predicts Your Life Span

div.div: This calculator estimates your expected life span, based on medical research and your own unique health factors.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VxyTue&via=Digg&text=This Calculator Predicts Your Life Span

div.a: The Easter Island Heads Have Bodies

div.div: It’s not known exactly why the bodies were buried – Were they buried on purpose? Or were they buried as a result of time and erosion?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SYfjci&via=Digg&text=The Easter Island Heads Have Bodies

div.a: Why Tweeting MLK's 'I Have A Dream' Speech Is Civil Disobedience

div.div: King’s speech is still under copyright—and therefore sharing it is an act of civil disobedience that honors both Internet Freedom Day and Martin Luther King Day this Monday.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SfRiMl&via=Digg&text=Why Tweeting MLK's 'I Have A Dream' Speech Is Civil Disobedience

div.a: Manti Te’o Gets The Taiwanese Animated Video Treatment

div.div: It’s hard to keep track of all the different characters and pieces of the story. But using animated leprechauns chugging beer bongs, Sims-style picture dialogue bubbles and flippant violin music, this video breaks the story down to a digestible two minutes.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YfijTv&via=Digg&text=Manti Te’o Gets The Taiwanese Animated Video Treatment

div.div: RICHARD MARX IS RIGHT HERE WAITING

div.a: When The 1980s Soft-Rock Balladeer You Mocked Online Won't Leave You Alone

div.div: Less than 24 hours after my article appeared, Richard Marx sent me a long email in which he attacked my looks, my marital status, my lack of professional achievement, my hypocrisy and my factual accuracy.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XkMG44&via=Digg&text=When The 1980s Soft-Rock Balladeer You Mocked Online Won't Leave You Alone

div.a: Manti Te'o Admits To 'Tailoring His Stories'

div.div: Te'o admitted that he deceived his parents and the press about the nature of his relationship with Lennay Kekua, but denied any involvement in the hoax.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XKYOhw&via=Digg&text=Manti Te'o Admits To 'Tailoring His Stories'

div.a: The Moment That Finally Made Lance Armstrong Cry

div.div: A lot of people criticized Lance Armstrong's performance for being emotionless in the first half of his big confessional interview with Oprah Winfrey, but we knew from earlier reports he was going to at least tear up at some point.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UXChMd&via=Digg&text=The Moment That Finally Made Lance Armstrong Cry

div.a: A Business Of Ferrets And 49 Other Collective Nouns To Bolster Your Vocabulary

div.div: Some collective nouns have achieved widespread currency and acceptance, like a “flight of stairs,” “a board of trustees,” and a “school of fish.” Others, like a “murder of crows,” barely cling on. Here are a few that you should add to your repertoire.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Vdezkz&via=Digg&text=A Business Of Ferrets And 49 Other Collective Nouns To Bolster Your Vocabulary

div.div: Eleven inches appears to be the size of Subway's footlong sandwich, according to a stream of photos posted online by angry customers around the world.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/10iCqAD&via=Digg&text=Is The Subway 'Footlong' Only 11 Inches?

div.div: The French aren't surprised by the fall of America's cycling hero. They knew he was cheating all along.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XfeFlD&via=Digg&text=France Vs. Lance

div.div: DOXED BY ONE OF HIS OWN

div.a: Wikileaks Claims Aaron Swartz Was Ally And Possible Source

div.div: Unsubstantiated statements implicate US Secret Service in Swartz's prosecution and break Wikileaks' own "doxxing" rules.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VQ9lcX&via=Digg&text=Wikileaks Claims Aaron Swartz Was Ally And Possible Source

div.a: Microsoft’s Epic Plan To Turn Your Living Room Into A Giant TV

div.div: Microsoft's new invention is called Illumiroom. A Kinect scans the shape of a room, then Illumiroom uses 3-D projection to paint your walls and furniture with images, breaking the borders of your TV like a dam bursting a river of pixels into your living space.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Se10Ps&via=Digg&text=Microsoft’s Epic Plan To Turn Your Living Room Into A Giant TV

div.a: Viral-Media Prof Blindsided By Kids Who Got 1M Facebook Likes, Puppy

div.div: The Cordell kids had to reach 1,000,000 Facebook likes to get a puppy. They did so in seven hours. Their dad, who studies viral media, never saw it coming.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UXccNh&via=Digg&text=Viral-Media Prof Blindsided By Kids Who Got 1M Facebook Likes, Puppy

div.a: How Aaron Swartz Joined The Fight Against SOPA

div.div: In a previously unpublished essay, the late Aaron Swartz explains how he came to be part of the fight to save the Internet. “For me, it all started with a phone call.”

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VwJjKF&via=Digg&text=How Aaron Swartz Joined The Fight Against SOPA

div.a: How NASA's Anti-Gravity Pen Helped Put A Man On The Moon

div.div: The Americans reputedly "spent millions" on an advanced pressurized space pen while the Soviets—they simply brought pencils.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XjWGKZ&via=Digg&text=How NASA's Anti-Gravity Pen Helped Put A Man On The Moon
